item.title: Report E-2024020146
item.description:
Report E-2024020146

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-01
  • City: COLUMBIANA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 1, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3082 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately thirty (30) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN3082-impacted dock floor and swept them in with hand tools. Crews observed that they would not be able to lift the tote for a gravity feed and instead did a bucket transfer of all the remaining contents into an additional 330-gallon tote. All spent absorbents, clean up debris, and cut up 330-gallon tote were collected and containerized into five (5) 55-gallon drums for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024010712
item.description:
Report X-2024010712

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-25
  • City: CLEVELAND
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A steel drum was presented to the CLER spill office with a loose cap. The spill agent noticed that the cap on the top of the drum was loose and released a small amount of the contents. It was placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper will be contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024020066
item.description:
Report X-2024020066

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-18
  • City: HAMILTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS IN A SPILL TUB ON THE HAZMAT TABLE. RESPONDER RESPONDED TO SPILL WITH FULL PPE ON AND OPENED UP PACKAGE. RESPONDER DISCOVERED THERE WAS A BOX WITHIN A BOX AND IT HAD A LIMITED QUANTITY LABEL ON IT WITH 6 BOTTLES OF PRESTONE DE-ICER. THERE WERE ALSO 6 LOOSE BOTTLES OF PRESTONE DE-ICER AND ONE OF THEM WAS LEAKING. THERE WAS NOT ANY LABELS ON THE OUTER CARTON SO RESPONDER CALLED THE HAZMAT MATERIAL HOTLINE AND PROCESSED US UNDECLARED THROUGH DMP.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Certified personnel were notified of a distressed package, which was pulled from the system. Leakage was contained to the box. Package was placed in a lined red tote. DescribePack: The protective cap came off allowing the nozzle to get pressed down and cause leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Bottles were empty

Report X-2024010767

  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: pkg was found during the unload process on 1-4 at 16:30 and taken to qa for inspection. DescribePack: carton was wet due to a leaking bottle that was cracked along the base. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ppe used to place carton in a hazmat bag and then into a plastic tote.

item.title: Report E-2024020066
item.description:
Report E-2024020066

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-07T15:11:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: CLEVELAND
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 31, 2024, one (1) 1-gallon pail of UN1263 was forked and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN1263-impacted trailer. ES personnel solidified the damaged pail of product and all impacted debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum which was taken into possession by ES personnel for disposal.
